results.title: Late at night
results.creator_credit: Michael C. Chorlton, Nettlefold Studios and Bruton Film Studios
results.brief_description: A London reporter investigates an organised crime ring. Stars Barry Morse; Noel Dryden; Daphne Day; Paul Demel; John Rae; Frank Atkinson; Dennis Harkin; Clifford Cobbe; Ben Williams; Claire Smith; Bill Holland; and Beryl Trent. Story and screenplay by Henry C. James; song ‘Late at Night’ by Arthur Young; musical direction by Arthur Young.

results.title: Last stands: Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Phil Lohrey, David Woodhall and Island Films
results.brief_description: The last stands of temperate rainforests in Tasmania. Examines the issues of the geology of the forest, the problems posed by hydroelectric schemes and logging operations.

results.title: Last grave at Dimbaza
results.brief_description: This film is a strident criticism of the operation of apartheid, and investigates most areas of life in South Africa, including the Bantustans. The film produces a visual catalogue of the disparity of conditions within life styles, between the blacks and the whites. (Awards: Mannheim-Heidelberg; Melbourne)

results.title: Last call at Maud's
results.creator_credit: Paris Poirer, Karen Kiss and Waterbearer Films
results.brief_description: Nostalgic look at an institution of lesbian culture in San Francisco—the legendary bar Maud’s. Closing in 1989 after more than 30 years of business, the history of Maud’s parallels the the evolution of the lesbian community and the gay rights movement in the United States. Through the reminisces and coming out stories of some of the bar’s long standing patrons, and the use of personal and public archival footage, a largely repressed history of lesbian social life emerges, beginning with the secret world of lesbian bars in the 1940s, through to the frightening vice raids of the 1950s, the colorful gay counter culture of the 1960s and the golden era of gay and lesbian life in San Franscisco in the 1970s and ending with the a reflection on the profound shifts in queer culture that took place in the 1980s. A witty and informative look at the emergence of a distinctly lesbian cultural life with its own unique codes through the eyes of the lesbian women who contributed to its shape.

results.title: Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Vern Barry, Film and Television Communications and United Airlines
results.brief_description: Las Vegas, Nevada, as seen through the eyes of a “go-go” girl. During the daytime various kinds of sports are seen, whilst at night the entertainment city comes to life with activities in casinos, at stage shows and restaurants. No dialogue - music only.

results.title: Language development in multicultural classroom: science
results.creator_credit: Lisa Milner and Sydney College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: Focuses on how to develop specific language related to science for English as a second Language students. It shows how grade 3 and 4 explored a theme around a unit on Space, providing the viewers with both strategies and practical ideas.

results.title: Cross cultural approach to acquisition of sex roles and social standards (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jerome Kagan, Glen Howard, Harper & Row and Bay State Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
The culturally diverse settings of Guatemala, Kenya and Japan focus on the basic mechanisms by which social standards and sex role orientations are acquired. Children are shown learning by the mechanisms of observation, imitation, praise and punishment.

results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Richard L. Berman, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glen Howard, Richard L. Berman, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row

results.title: Language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines the child’s language process in the first four years, beginning with the development of phonemes, semantics and syntax. Looks at the process by which language is acquired and how that acquisition can be influenced.
